N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 260.3 - Criteria for allowances

State Regulations
(a) All
recommendations and decisions must be made through completely impersonal, impartial and fair and reasonable evaluations. (b) In evaluating the amount of allowance to
be granted, the statutory criteria (i.e., good behavior, efficient and willing
performance of duties assigned, progress and achievement in an assigned
treatment program) shall be viewed in the light of the following factors: (1)
the attitude of the inmate; (2)
the capacity of the inmate; and
(3)
the efforts made by the inmate within the
limits of his capacity. Notes
